metadata.Title: CVE-2022-30635 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Uncontrolled recursion in Decoder.Decode in encoding/gob before Go 1.17.12and Go 1.18.4 allows an attacker to cause a panic due to stack exhaustionvia a message which contains deeply nested structures.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-30635` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

golang-1.18 - 1.18.1-1ubuntu1~18.04.4
golang-1.18-go - 1.18.1-1ubuntu1~18.04.4
golang-1.18-src - 1.18.1-1ubuntu1~18.04.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: golang-1.18 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.18.1-1ubuntu1~18.04.4').
golang-1.16: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
golang-1.13: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
